title: Ex-NFL wideout Robert Meachem jailed for not paying $400K in child support, alimony
text:
Ex-NFL wideout Robert Meachem jailed for not paying $400K in child support, alimony 
By Nunzio Ingrassia Facebook 0 Twitter 0 Email Print 
Sep 8, 2013; New Orleans, LA, USA; New Orleans Saints wide receiver Robert Meachem against the Atlanta Falcons during a game at the Mercedes-Benz Superdome. The Saints defeated the Falcons 23-17. Mandatory Credit: Derick E. Hingle-USA TODAY Sports 
Former NFL wide receiver Robert Meachem was sentenced to 30 days in jail after failing to pay nearly $400,000 in alimony and child support. Meachem began serving that sentence Monday. 
Meachem could be released earlier if he pays his ex-wife, Andrea Rhodes, $100,000, but barring that, he will remain in jail until March 15, according to court documents obtained by the New Orleans Times-Picayune . 
Meachem, who made more than $20 million during his eight-year career, and Rhodes divorced in November 2015, according to court records. He was ordered to pay $20,000 a month in spousal and child support for the couple's two children, but attorneys for Rhodes asked the court last year to hold Meachem in contempt for failing to make payments.
